assessments.status_rationale: Today’s news includes reporting that the Trump administration has stopped/paused offshore wind projects, but it does not provide definitive evidence about whether BOEM will or will not conduct a competitive offshore wind lease auction during 2025-12-23 to 2026-06-30.
No item in today’s news indicates Dominion Energy has disclosed (or not disclosed) a ≥$500M offshore-wind-related impairment/write-down/valuation charge in an SEC filing or earnings release.
Today’s bullets include U.S.–China tariff-related reporting, but nothing about the European Commission initiating a WTO dispute against China over reported tariffs on EU dairy.
No reporting in today’s news confirms that the India–New Zealand free-trade agreement has entered into force or that an effective date has been announced.

CNBC reports gold crossing $4,500 and reaching fresh highs, but this is not explicit evidence of a daily close above the 2025-12-22 record close (and it does not state what the 2025-12-22 record close was).
No bullet indicates Alphabet/Google has announced a North America data-center power procurement deal totaling ≥1.0 GW.
Today’s media-related items mention a CBS/60 Minutes report but provide no evidence of a definitive merger agreement between Warner Bros. Discovery and Paramount.
There is no financial-report evidence in today’s news about Novo Nordisk reporting ≥$500M in quarterly net sales for a newly approved oral GLP-1 obesity pill.
No bullet describes the DoD awarding/announcing a ≥$150M contract or OTA to expand U.S. rare-earth permanent magnet manufacturing capacity.
Nothing in today’s news references Denmark announcing a new Arctic/Greenland security spending package totaling at least DKK 5.0 billion.
Today’s items do not include CPI detail for the BLS ‘distilled spirits’ category, so there is no clear evidence about whether it is negative year-over-year in any published CPI release.
